comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Peeling paint in several areas. Recommend sanding and repainting.
Previous repairs noted. Recommend monitoring for on-going or future problems.
Annual maintenance is recommend at composite wood fiber siding including painting & caulking/sealing intersections between dissimilar building materials and siding seams. This will help prevent moisture intrusion issues and extend the usable life of the siding.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Foundation is not fully visible, however the visible areas appear serviceable with typical repairs noted for the age of the structure.

comments.name: CRAWL SPACE ACCESSIBILITY
comments.text: Crawlspace is partially accessible, however, viewing is limited in some areas; only partially entered/partially inspected.

comments.name: CRAWL SPACE COLUMNS OR SUPPORTS OR PIERS
comments.text:
Type of piers viewed: wood 

The following concerns were noted at the columns/supports in the crawlspace:
Some Non-professional repairs noted. Recommend monitoring for problems and repair as needed.

comments.name: BASEMENT INFORMATION
comments.text:
Basement is unfinished

The following concerns were noted at the basement floor:
Previous repairs noted. Recommend verifying with seller the reasons and monitor for problems.

comments.name: BASEMENT COLUMNS OR SUPPORTS OR PIERS
comments.text:
Type of piers viewed:
Wood

The following concerns were noted at the columns/supports in the basement:
Non-professional repairs/install noted, repair or replace as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the landscaping:
Trees are overhanging the roof.  Damage is possible. Trim plants and trees away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable with signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.

The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Tree debris noted on the roof in some areas. Recommend cleaning.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text:
Full gutter system appears serviceable.

The following concerns were noted at the gutters:
Debris in the gutters throughout. Recommend cleaning.

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text: Copper Main line is 3/4 inch diameter

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable, valve not tested, water pressure appears adequate.

The following concerns were noted at the main water line:
Shut off is not in an easily accessible location. Consider contacting a qualified professional to reroute to an easily accessible location.

comments.name: OPERATION
comments.text:
Sample operated appeared serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the hose faucets:
Missing valve handle noted at the hose faucet at the garage.

comments.name: METER OR TANK LOCATION-CONDITION
comments.text:
Meter located at the exterior: 
Right side of the house.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
Pressure relief valve noted not tested
A water shutoff valve is installed.

The following concerns were noted at the water heater:
Rust/corrosion noted at the shut off valve.
Some rusting noted at the line connections.
Some rusting noted at the exterior bottom of the water heater.
Recommend monitoring for problems and repair/replace as needed.

comments.name: MAIN PANEL LOCATION
comments.text:
Exterior:
 Right side of the house

comments.name: MAIN PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

The following concerns were noted at the main electrical panel:
The circuit breakers are not labeled on the panel cover. Consider having a qualified professional label the location for each circuit. 
Missing fastener at deadfront cover. Recommend correction.
Missing breaker blank covers noted. Recommend correction.

comments.name: PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible

The following concerns were noted at the electrical panel:
Non professional install/repairs noted.
Evidence of previous arcing noted in the panel.
Improper sharp tip fasteners used at the panel cover. Recommend correction.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed electrician and repair or replace.

comments.name: PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

The following concerns were noted at the electrical panel:
Non professional repairs noted. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed electrician and repair or replace.
Missing blank covers noted. Recommend correction.
Improper fastener type noted at the panel cover. Recommend correction.

comments.name: PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the electrical panel:
Over fusing at main panel. (fuse or breaker size appears to be too large for wire size) 15A wire noted on a 30A circuit.

comments.name: BRANCH WIRING CIRCUIT CONDUCTORS
comments.text:
Type of conductor noted:
Non-Metallic cable with Metal/Plastic conduit

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible switches and receptacles were tested.  As a whole receptacles and switches throughout the building are in serviceable condition.

The following concerns were noted with the switches and receptacles:
Garage outlets were not GFCI protected.
Exterior outlets were not GFCI protected.
Kitchen outlets within 6’ of the sink were not GFCI protected.
Bathroom outlet was not GFCI protected.
Hot neutral reversed noted at several outlets.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed electrician and repair or replace.
Missing switch cover noted near the kitchen door. Recommend correction.

comments.name: CONDITION OF SINK
comments.text:
Sink appears serviceable
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appear serviceable
Counters/cabinets appear serviceable.

comments.name: TUB OR SHOWER PLUMBING FIXTURES
comments.text:
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appears serviceable
Shower head appears serviceable

comments.name: TUB OR SHOWER AND WALLS
comments.text:
Tub and shower areas appear serviceable

Tile noted at walls. Unable to verify substrate preparation techniques.  Recommend regular grouting sealing and caulking to maintain integrity.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

It appears as if supply and waste plumbing has been installed. Their may have been a bathroom present or planned in the garage.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appear serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the walls/ceiling:
Peeling paint noted
Previous repairs needed.
Annual maintenance is recommend at composite wood fiber siding including painting & caulking/sealing intersections between dissimilar building materials and siding seams. This will help prevent moisture intrusion issues and extend the usable life of the siding.

comments.name: MAIN ENTRY DOOR
comments.text: Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems. Recommend regular caulking/painting/maintenance

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible windows were inspected.  Windows as a grouping are generally operational and appear serviceable but signs of significant wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

The following concerns were noted at the windows:
Broken glass noted at the kitchen window. Recommend repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the interior walls:
Previous repairs noted in multiple areas. Verify reason with seller and monitor for on-going or future problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of typical wear noted. Repair/replace as needed.

The following concerns were noted with the floors:
Cracked tiles noted.
Deteriorated grout noted.
Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.
Typical settling noted at the floors throughout.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Interior stairs appear serviceable
Stair handrails appear serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the stairs/handrails:
Some chipping/spalling noted. Recommend repairs as needed.

comments.name: ACCESSIBILITY
comments.text: Attic was too small to enter. Unable to fully inspect. Attic was viewed from hatch area only. Recommend creating a larger access point.

comments.name: VENTILATION
comments.text:
Attic ventilation is provided by:
Stationary vents

comments.name: COMMENTS
comments.text: Smoke detectors are present and the button sounded the alarm

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Faucet appears serviceable
Hand sprayer appears serviceable
Drain appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted with the kitchen sink:
Leaks noted at the faucet swivel. Recommend repair or replace.

comments.name: KITCHEN CABINETS OR COUNTERTOPS
comments.text: Cabinets and counter tops appear serviceable

items.name: RANGE OR COOK TOP AND OVEN

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the range/cook top and oven:
Range burners did not self ignite at the time of inspection. A lighter was needed to light the burners. Recommend repair or replace.

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text: Recirculating type hood. Recommend regular cleaning of filters for proper operation.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the disposal:
Metal Debris noted in the garage disposal. Recommend correction.

comments.name: ELECTRICAL AND GAS CONDITION
comments.text: 3 prong outlet provided.  Recommend upgrading to a 4 prong outlet if possible.

comments.name: DRYER VENTING CONDITION
comments.text:
Dryer venting is provided

The following concerns were noted at the dryer vent:
Vent is currently disconnected from the dryer. Recommend correction.

comments.name: DUCTS OR AIR SUPPLY
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

Note: floor duct is a return duct.

comments.name: HEATING FUEL TYPE
comments.text: Natural Gas. (The heat exchanger portion of a gas or oil fired heater is difficult to access without disassembly and cannot be adequately checked during a visual inspection.  We recommend a service contract be placed on the unit and a heating contractor called to verify the condition of the heat exchanger prior to settlement date.)

comments.name: HEATING SYSTEM CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

The following concerns were noted at the heating system:
Heating system appears to be over 20 years old.  Units of this advanced age are more susceptible to heat exchanger problems.  It is recommended that any unit over 20 years of age be evaluated by a qualified licensed HVAC professional prior to closing to clean/service the blower motor, vent system, burner chamber and make necessary repairs/replacements as needed.

comments.name: BURNERS OR HEAT EXCHANGERS
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the burner/heat exchanger:
Unusual flame pattern noted. Cleaning my be needed.
Recommend evaluation by a licensed HVAC technician and service.

comments.name: HEATING SYSTEM PUMP OR BLOWER FAN
BUILDING OCCUPIED?
comments.text: Yes  (It is assumed that some areas are concealed by furniture or other personal property. Inspectors are not allowed to move personal property during their inspection. It is highly recommended that the purchaser perform a thorough inspection during their final walk through.)
